title.narrative: Second Kampala Institutional and Infrastructure Development Project

description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is enhanced infrastructure and institutional capacity of KCCA to improve urban mobility in Kampala.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Contract Management System | Description :The Recipient, through the Project Implementing Entity, shall, notlater than twelve (12) months after the Effective Date, establish a contract management system, in form and substance acceptable tothe Association. | Due Date :01-Jul-2015

Finance Agreement :Procurement Filing and Records | Description :The Recipient, through the Project Implementing Entity, shall, notlater than six (6) months after the Effective Date, update its procurement filing and record keeping system, in form and substanceacceptable to the Association. | Due Date :01-Dec-2014

Finance Agreement :Procurement Specialist | Description :The Recipient shall, not later than one (1) month after the EffectiveDate, appoint a procurement specialist, in accordance SectionIII of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement. | Due Date :01-Aug-2014

Finance Agreement :Procurement Training | Description :The Recipient, through the Project Implementing Entity, shall, not laterthan twelve (12) months after the Effective Date, provide procurement training for PDU staff and contract managers, under terms ofreference acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :01-Jul-2015

Finance Agreement :Project Escrow Account | Description :The Recipient shall, through the Project Implementing Entity, open, andthereafter maintain, at all times during the implementationof the Project, in a financial institution and on terms and conditionsacceptable to the Association, a Project Escrow Account, intowhich all counterpart funds required for the Project shall bedeposited and maintained until required to pay for RAP compensation costs | Due Date :01-Jul-2014
